docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
LeaderstatsPlus makes it simpler to create and manage the leaderstats folder and values. Gone are the days where you need many lines of code just to edit a value.

Creating the leaderstats folder is as simple as:

local lsplus = require(game.ReplicatedStorage.lsplus)
game.Players.PlayerAdded:Connect(function(plr)
    lsplus.init(plr)
    lsplus.add("int", "Cash", plr)
    lsplus.edit("Cash", 100, plr)
end)

docs.title: 1 - Download from Releases
docs.text:
1. Download the latest release from github
  2. Insert the model into your game.

docs.title: 2 - Download from Wally
docs.text:
1. View lsplus on wally.run
  2. Copy the text under "Install"
  3. Add it under dependencies in wally.toml
  4. Run wally install in the terminal

docs.title: .add()
docs.text: The add function adds a value to the leaderstats folder using the args provided by you.

docs.title: Args (in order)
docs.text:
• type - Can be "string" or "int", must be a string.
  • name - The name of the value, must be a string.
  • plr - The player object in game.Players.

docs.title: .edit()
docs.text: The edit function edits a value based on what args are passed.

docs.title: Args
docs.text:
• name - The name of the value, must be a string.
  • val - The value will be changed to this, must be the same as the type of the val.
  • plr - The player object in game.Players.

docs.title: .init()
docs.text: The init function creates the leaderstats folder in the player.

docs.title: Args
docs.text: • plr - Must be the player object in game.Players.
